intro: Commersonia tahitensis, commonly known as the Tahitian commersonia, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, leathery leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
